text: Demarchos or Demarchus () has historically been a Greek civic office. It can also refer to people of that name. These include: * In Greek mythology, a son of Aegyptus, murdered by Eubule, one of the Danaïdes. * An epic poet in an inscription in Ptolemais * Demarchos, the son of Taron, a Lycian honoured by the Samians for his intercession on their behalf with Demetrios Poliorketes * Demarchos, the son of Epidokos, a Syracusan general and opponent of the tyrant Dionysius I * Satrap of Hellespontine Phrygia under Alexander the Great, successor of Calas ==References==
title: Demarchos (name)
